DOC.brief_summary: The current study was designed to investigate the influence of choice of exercise program on exercise adherence. The two exercise programs included 1) traditional exercise at a fitness centre or 2) lifestyle exercise-walking using a pedometer to track steps. Biological and psychological indicators were examined to investigate the effect of choice in a sample of sedentary adults.
DOC.criteria: 2565 year old adults sedentary (exercise less than twice per month in the last 4 months) physician nonconsent too active (exercise more than twice per month in the last 4 months) participated in previous studies from this lab
